intro: Morronea parviglumis, commonly known as the small-lobed morron, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, palmately lobed leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in wetlands and along stream banks, preferring moist, well-drained soils. Morronea parviglumis is often found in shaded to partially shaded environments and is an important species for local ecosystems.
